intro: Simaba cavalcantei, commonly known as the Brazilian mahogany or *marmelada*, is a tropical tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, reddish-brown wood. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by bright red, fleshy berries that contain seeds. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an endangered species in its native habitat.
